minority.long_description: A minority-owned business is a U.S. business that is at least 51% owned by, and whose management and daily business operations are controlled by, one or more members of a socially and economically disadvantaged minority group, namely U.S. citizens who are African Americans (Black), Hispanic Americans, Native Americans, Asian-Pacific Americans and Sub-Continent Asian Americans.

non_minority.long_description: A non-minority-owned business is a U.S. business that is at least 51% owned by, and whose management and daily business operations are controlled by, one or more members not of a socially and economically disadvantaged minority group, namely U.S. citizens who are African Americans (Black), Hispanic Americans, Native Americans, Asian-Pacific Americans and Sub-Continent Asian Americans.

entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry_rate=\frac{new_businesses}{all_businesses}\]
entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

exit_rate.long_description: Percent of closed businesses (a closed business is a company that stoped its activities or leaving the region): \[exit_rate=\frac{exited_businesses}{all_businesses}\]

new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region)

exit_business.long_description: Count of all closed businesses (a closed business is a company that stoped its activities or leaving the region)
